solution.text:
Amount spent by Ravi on clothes\(=\)Rs.\(_{{j*100}}_\)
From the pie chart,
Ravi spent \(32\)% of his pocket money on clothes.
Let Ravi's pocket money be \(x\).
\(\Rightarrow \frac{32}{100} \times x=_{{j*100}}_\)
\(\Rightarrow x=\frac{_{{j*100}}_ \times 100}{32}\)
\(x=_{{(j*100*100)/(Decimal(32))}}_\)
From the pie chart,
Ravi spent \(27\)% of his pocket money on video games.
Amount spent by Ravi on video games\(=\frac{27}{100} \times _{{(j*100*100)/(Decimal(32))}}_\)
\(=\)Rs.\(_{{(27*100*j)/(Decimal(32))}}_\)

content.text: If he spent Rs.\(_{{j*100}}_\) on clothes, how much did he spend on videogames?
